parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Lord Cedric to what do I owe the pleasure? \|\|\^
I came to discuss this war with you. \|\|\^
The war? What is there to discuss? \|\|\^
Well, I would like to know why you haven’t offered support for Prince Lansee? \|\|\^
Yes. Usually, in war, it’s your king vs your enemies. However this time it’s - \|\|\^
- our prince vs his brothers who are also princes of Rinsar. They - \|\|\^
- are all viable heirs to the throne and so whatever the outcome they - \|\|\^
- would still be a legitimate heir. Currently, Prince Lansee doesn’t stand - \|\|\^
- a chance against his brothers' forces. So I won’t risk my house in this war. \|\|\^
I second Lord Mustel. The chances of survival are low if we support him. - \|\|\^
- It’s sad but it’s the truth. Sometimes we must do bad things in order - \|\|\^
I can’t believe this, you all are abandoning him. He’s the rightful heir. - \|\|\^
- Instead, you would rather support these monsters that have brought - \|\|\^
- nothing but terror to the southern kingdoms. I can’t believe you - \|\|\^
- are the type of leaders we have, you ought to be ashamed of yourselves. \|\|\^
Now you insult us?! You didn’t like the answer we gave, we understand. - \|\|\^
I told you to stop. Guards dispose of him. \|\|\^

Hello Lord Cedric, what is it you want? \|\|\^
I came to see if you would help in the removal of Roswell? \|\|\^
It’s the right thing to do. \|\|\^
No, it’s not. Since Roswell took over, my wealth and power has grown immensely. - \|\|\^
- Removing Roswell would put that in jeopardy. \|\|\^
Very well I will find help elsewhere. \|\|\^
Lord Mustel's entry in the Journal was updated.

Hello Lord Cedric and King Dormato. I know why your here. Please reconsider. - \|\|\^
- We can work together to make Rinsar a better place. \|\|\^
I am. By removing you. Guards! \|\|\^
No I am not going. Guards! \|\|\^
